title: Epstein's correspondence reveals links to French public figures
subhead: Millions of emails released by the US Department of Justice reveal the financier's relationships, some more intense than others, with several figures from France's politics and culture.

title: 'Not only is Trump not crazy, but he is dangerous': Historian Laure Murat salutes Minneapolis 'lesson in democracy'
'The Kurds had Western support, especially from the US. That support has now been withdrawn.'
Cuba says 'willing to engage in dialogue' with the US
subhead: After months of threats from Trump and in the midst of an economic crisis, Cuban President Miguel Diaz-Canel said that any talks must take place 'from a position of equals' and without 'interference in our internal affairs.'

title: Epstein affair: Former Norwegian prime minister Thorbjørn Jagland under investigation for corruption
subhead: The Norwegian police have announced the opening of an investigation into Thorbjørn Jagland, who led the Labour government from 1996 to 1997, on suspicion of 'aggravated corruption' in connection with his past ties to the American sex offender.

title: Secondhand market booms, challenging luxury industry
subhead: The market for pre-owned luxury goods has been growing by 10% each year, but specialized resale platforms have struggled to find a profitable business model.

title: Lore Baudrit, captain of France's Olympic women's hockey team: 'We train like pros, but don't get paid'
subhead: The forward, who has played 250 times for the national team, was set to take part in the first Olympic tournament of her career starting Thursday. Like most of her teammates, she has to juggle life as a top-level athlete with a day job.

Democracy is fading in Africa as the world looks away
subhead: While global powers covet Africa's natural resources, they have paid little attention to the wave of coups that have swept the continent in recent years.

title: Ukraine's 'grandfathers' go to war
subhead: The Ukrainian army has an average age of 45, significantly older than European standards. The draft has targeted men between the ages of 25 and 60, which contrasts with recruitment practices typically seen in Western countries.

title: Gabriella Papadakis, ice dancer: 'My mother turned me into a little soldier who let herself be guided by the decisions of others'
subhead: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The figure skater and former Olympic champion looks back on a childhood filled with constraints in order to succeed in a demanding and conservative environment.

title: The unresolved contradictions of the Winter Olympics
